subject: Writing
title: Gothic Horror and the Dark Imagination
description: A fast breakdown of Gothic Horror and the Dark Imagination for builders.

hook.text: Horace Walpole woke from a nightmare about a giant armored hand. He wrote it down and invented Gothic fiction.

buildup.text: The Castle of Otranto, published in 1764, launched a genre of crumbling castles, ghosts, and dread.

discovery.text: Gothic fiction explored the emotions the Enlightenment tried to suppress â€” fear, desire, and madness.

twist.text: Shelley's Frankenstein, Stoker's Dracula, and Poe's tales all descend from Walpole's one bad dream.

climax.text: Horror became fiction's shadow â€” a genre that reveals what polite literature refuses to discuss.

punchline.text: Nightmares became one of literature's most productive genres.

quiz.question: What novel is considered the first Gothic fiction?
